author: Roberto Bolaño
description: Bolaño’s sprawling posthumous epic spans continents, literary obsessions, and a haunting series of crimes in the desert city of Santa Teresa.

title: Gravity and Grace
author: Simone Weil
description: A collection of Weil’s notebooks reflecting on attention, suffering, and spirituality—dense but illuminating philosophical fragments.

title: Man and His Symbols
author: Carl G. Jung
description: Jung’s accessible introduction to analytical psychology, symbolism, and the language of dreams, compiled with his closest collaborators.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Dostoevsky’s psychological masterpiece follows Raskolnikov’s inner turmoil after committing murder in St. Petersburg.

title: The Myth of Sisyphus
author: Albert Camus
description: Camus meditates on the absurd, rebellion, and what it means to live without appeal in a seemingly meaningless universe.
